name: indistinctive
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
Something that is indistinctive is not easy to recognize or remember because it is similar to many other things: The soup had a mild and indistinctive flavour. He was a nondescript sort of man with dark hair and indistinctive features.
More examplesFewer examplesIt is much easier to remember a series of highly distinctive names than a list of relatively indistinctive names.Much of the music that is being produced today is dull and indistinctive.She performed a selection of familiar songs to the accompaniment of a competent but indistinctive group of musicians.
